Publication Title: Gαs is dispensable for β-arrestin coupling but dictates GRK selectivity and is predominant for gene expression regulation by β2-adrenergic receptor
Publication Keywords: G protein, Signaling, Gene Expression, G Protein–coupled Receptor, Β-arrestin
Publication Authors: Valeria Burghi, Justine S Paradis, Adam Officer, Sendi Rafael Adame-Garcia, Xingyu Wu, Edda S F Matthees, Benjamin Barsi-Rhyne, Dana J Ramms, Lauren Clubb, Monica Acosta, Pablo Tamayo, Michel Bouvier, Asuka Inoue, Mark von Zastrow, Carsten Hoffmann, J Silvio Gutkind
Publication Abstract: β-arrestins play a key role in G protein-coupled receptor (GPCR) internalization, trafficking, and signaling. Whether β-arrestins act independently of G protein-mediated signaling has not been fully elucidated.
